history.content:
I think it depends on which Stat 15x course you want to take. Some of them may use material from Stat 135 (you could potentially self-study the material, but I think it's better to have a strong foundation in statistics). Stat 150 is an option because it is pure probability and therefore does not require Stat 135; make sure you have a good probability foundation (including a good handle on continuous probability).

Another option that I suggest (forgive me for being biased) is EE 126, which is an application-driven course on probability models. It is designed for you to take after CS 70.

children.subject: Since there are so few people on the waitlist for Data Science 100 currently (like only around 10) for a class of 237 -- does that mean your chances of getting into the class are fairly high?

history.content:
I'm a rising EECS junior interested in data science, took 186,188 last semester and will be taking 189 this Fall semester.

When I checked the enrollment, I thought Data 100 wouldn't get filled up and swapped it with a different course.

Since the course is now full and I am most likely to not get in, what are some relevant Stat/Data Science courses to take?

(I haven't taken any of Stat courses in Berkeley, so the recommended ones are probably 134 or 135, but I am going to take 140, which I heard overlaps with 134, next Spring and I most likely won't be able to enroll in 135 due to a schedule conflict.)

Will Stat 150 series be doable based on materials from CS 70 and some of 188?
history.subject: Stat/Data Science Courses to Take
